overview: his subject involves the development and application of the tools of bioinformatics to address a significant research problem. The subject also provides students with skills and knowledge for understanding original research and enhanced written and oral communication skills.

The process of matching students with supervisors and research projects will occur in the first semester of enrolment of the Bioinformatics stream of the Master of Science. Apart from the help and guidance from their supervisor(s) each student also has a committee that regularly meets with them and provides additional help and expertise. This committee is responsible for assessment of the research project subject.
Students need to ensure they have completed a total of 50points Research Project by the end of their course.
intended learning outcomes: development and application of bioinformatics tools in the analysis of scientific data;
writing research proposals, reports and a thesis

assessments.description: One research proposal incorporating a literature review. 5000 words
assessments.timing: In the first semester of this Project

assessments.description: An oral presentation on the proposed research. 20 minutes
assessments.timing: In the first semester of this Project

assessments.description: A progress report on the research project. 3000 words
assessments.timing: In the second semester of this Project
At the end of the final semester of this Project
At the end of the final semester of this Project

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
